p: Perilla frutescens Britton var. acuta Kudo leaves cultivated at Sancheong Herb Medicinal Cooperative (Sancheong, Republic of Korea) were purchased. The sample was prepared by the method outlined by Kim et al. [ 36]. The sample was air dried at 60 °C for moisture removal after which it was subjected to pulverization using a 50-mesh sieve. A sample (40 g) was roasted at 150 °C for 0, 2, 4, 6, and 8 min on a frying pan and an infrared thermometer (Infrared DT-8380, InnoCal Solutions Co., Vernon Hills, IL, USA) was used to measure the temperature. The roasted and pulverized sample was frozen and kept at −40 °C until further analyses.
